Issue.Description: Those who support Illegal Immigration Enforcement as an issue believe the United States needs to be stricter about enforcing policies and enacting punishment on those who enter the United States through illegal or unofficial channels.
Support for Stricter Border Protection means utilizing more funds and resources to secure the border and prevent illegal entry into the United States.
Those supporting Strict Deportation believe that the United States must be harsher about deporting illegal aliens, including those who have overstayed their visas.
Support for Immigration Reform means supporting the use of funds and resources to expand and streamline the citizen process to make it easier for immigrants to become United States citizens.
Those who support "finishing the wall" want to construct a physical barrier at the border to prevent illegal entry into the country.
Advocates for Repeal Obamacare argue that the Obamacare introduced too much government interference into the healthcare system and strained the average American citizen.

Support for Insurance Company Transparency argues that to tackle the problem of healthcare prices, insurance companies should be made more transparent with more competition introduced to drive down Insurance costs.
Those who support Expand Medicare / Medicaid are interested in making Healthcare more accessible and affordable by alleviating the burden of the current system of insurance.

Those who support Abortion believe that pregnant individuals have a right to abortion access. Many argue against the overturning of Roe v. Wade and that protections must be ensured on a federal level.

Supporting Mental Health Services Expansion means pushing for more funds and resources to be put toward supporting facilities and social support programs to improve mental health and assist with behavioral disorders.

Advocates for Lowering Drug Prices want the federal government to regulate the price of prescription medication. They argue the cost of medication controlled by private corporations is often too high for the average citizen.
Those who support "taxes are theft" argue that ideologically, taxes are unconstitutional and should not be taken from American citizens.

The proposal for Individual Tax Cuts is to reduce the taxes individuals are expected to pay so they may have more money to stimulate the economy. However, doing so would likely mean raising taxes from other sources.
Supporting increasing the taxes of the wealthy involves increasing how heavily those with drastically more wealth are taxed and can include closing loopholes commonly used to avoid paying taxes.
Those advocating for Free Market Capitalism want to keep the Government's involvement in the economy at a minimum.
Supporting Corporate Tax Cuts involves reducing the amount of taxes corporations are expected to pay, ideally giving corporations more funds to use on jobs and employee benefits.

Advocates for Universal Basic Income argue that providing all Americans with enough money to afford basic shelter and food will increase everyone's standard of living, lift people out of poverty, and improve economic health.

Advocates for Higher Minimum Wage argue that wages have stagnated without sufficient increases to the federal minimum wage to combat inflation and the rising cost of living. They reason that a minimum wage that keeps up with the cost benefits individuals and the economy.
Advocates for Reducing Wealth Inequality argue that the economic gap between most Americans and the few with excessive wealth is widening and an issue to be addressed.
Those who support Unions argue that unionized workers are a vital part of the economic system to ensure workers' rights and fair wages, especially for specialized labor.

Job Outsourcing is often characterized by opposition. Opponents of Job Outsourcing claim too many American jobs are lost to companies outsourcing work, and resources and efforts need to be taken to save jobs in the United States.

Many Americans are losing their job due to automation and outsourcing. Those behind supporting Job Training argue that the federal government should provide programs and resources so those affected may find work in a new industry.
Advocates for Small Businesses work to benefit and protect the many small businesses across the United States, arguing they are a vital and fundamental part of the economy and the American dream.

Those who support Social Security Reform believe the best way to avoid the Social Security crisis is to change the system, such as limiting the benefits of wealthy retirees, reducing the benefits of those who retire early, increasing the Social Security tax, and more.

Those in favor of Raising the Retirement Age point out that the current Social Security program is at risk. To keep it going, those entering or newly introduced to the workforce should be expected to work longer to ensure a stronger safety net.
Those who support Pharmaceutical Companies put forward that private companies dedicated to researching and developing medication are vital to healthcare and the economy.
Those in favor of Agricultural Support put forward that the United States has a duty to ensure its farmers and agriculture workers are taken care of and supported through various government programs.

Those who argue for Energy Independence say that America has become far too reliant on other countries for energy and energy supplies. Those in support of Energy Independence often want an independent, if not dominant, American Energy Industry.
Those in support of Natural Gas and Oil state that the United States should retain a substantial supply of gas and oil and, if not, strengthen the avenues by which it is acquired and transported.

Supporters for Addressing Climate Change argue climate change is caused primarily by humans and industrial practices - that there is a responsibility to decrease emissions, promote sustainability, and reduce / recover some of the damage done.
Those in support of the Dakota Access Pipeline argue that the environmental and social concerns are not severe enough to hold up the completion of the crude oil pipeline.
Those in support of the Keystone XL Pipeline argue that the environmental and social concerns are not severe enough to hold up the completion of the crude oil pipeline.

Those in support of Renewable Energy argue that the United States needs to pursue alternative energy sources that could prove more reliable in the long term. Support for Renewable Energy often includes support for efforts to address climate change.
Those who support the idea of a Green New Deal are pushing for policies that address climate change while working towards other social causes such as job creation and economic growth.

Advocates for Environmental Protection state that protecting and restoring the environment should be a priority for the federal government. Most argue that Environmental Protection is a part of addressing climate change or argue for the maintenance of public lands.

Advocates for Green Jobs push for using funds and resources to encourage the creation of ecologically friendly jobs. Green jobs focus on careers supporting the environment and addressing climate change.

Marine Environmental Protection is a branch of Environmental Protection that focuses on the ecosystems of bodies of water with particular attention to coral reef health, fishery sustainability, and managing waterway pollution.

Issues.Issue: Strong Military STRONGMILITARY Strong Military is based on the idea that the best way to avoid and end wars is to ensure that the United States has a visibly strong military. 3 -2 3 5 2 4 3 -5 4 4 3 1f 3 -2 4 2 3 0 4 -4 7 6 5 1 3 -2 6 5 4 1 4 1 2 6 3 3

Issue.Description: Those in support of Tariffs argue that increased tariffs reward domestic production and discourage relying on foreign companies, with the end goal being to keep jobs in America.

Those in favor of Sanctions on Russia want to challenge Russia's ongoing military and trade threats. They argue that the United States, as a superpower, is responsible for opposing Russian expansion and exploitation.

Those in favor of Sending Aid to Ukraine argue the United States should provide Ukraine support with funds, armament, or military forces. They reason that the United States has a duty to help the smaller global power defend itself and its democracy.

Support for Backing Israel has shifted with recent conflicts in the region. Those who support Backing Israel argue the United States should maintain its relationship with Israel and work through the current conflict.
Supporters of Leaving the UN want the United States to pull out of the United Nations, reasoning that the United States does not benefit from being in the UN.
Those in favor of Pulling out of NATO argue that the United States has long contributed more than its fair share. They state the United States does not benefit from contributing to NATO.
Trade with China is characterized mainly by opposition. Those who oppose Trade with China argue that China benefits unfairly from foreign trade and often undercuts American jobs.

Those who support Favorable Trade argue that the United States has been partaking in unfair trade and trade agreements. They put forward that America needs to be more aggressive in making new deals that favor the United States.
Those who support Draining the Swamp argue that the federal government has become bogged down by entrenched politicians who no longer serve the people they are supposed to represent.

ESG stands for Environmental, Social, and Corporate Governance. ESG is a method of governing that focuses on tackling environmental and social concerns by holding corporations to specific standards. Those in support argue that ESG is a great way to tackle many modern problems.
Those who support, or at least don't oppose, Deficit Spending argue it is a necessity to keep the government running and is to be expected with a large federal government.

Advocates for Addressing Inflation state that all should be concerned about the current rate of inflation, which is causing everyday living expenses like groceries to balloon beyond what most Americans can afford; therefore, lowering the inflation rate is vital to protect the public.

Advocates for Moving Agencies out of DC propose that agencies and elements of federal bureaucracy would perform better and be able to reduce costs if their primary offices were not in DC, an expensive and already busy location.

Those who support States Rights argue that the authority of individual states have become too inconsequential against federal laws. They put forward that states should be given more power and authority to govern themselves.

Advocates for Reduce Regulation state that government regulation can hinder and harm private corporations and individuals. Supporters argue that reducing regulation will allow the private sector to thrive and provide citizens more freedom.
Those who support Intelligence Agency Transparency argue that several government organizations like the FBI and CIA are allowed too much secrecy, which does more harm than good.

Supporting Intelligence Agency Reform entails an overhaul of some degree to elements of the United States government such as the CIA, FBI, and Department of Justice. Supporters argue those departments have gone with too little overview for too long.

Supporters of Disaster Preparedness argue that funds and resources need to be set aside and training be made more extensively available to help prepare for combating disasters and easing disaster relief.
Those favoring Tough on Crime policies argue they are the best way to keep citizens safe and ensure justice is reliably served.
Supporters for the issue of Racial Equality Initiatives aim to tackle multiple aspects of modern America, arguing that conscious and subconscious biases have affected thousands unfairly.

Supporters of Stronger Law Enforcement push for law enforcement agencies across the United States to receive better funding for the officers and their equipment. They argue law enforcement officers are vital to a safe, secure, and just nation.
Those in favor of Policing Reform argue that officers should be held to a higher standard of accountability, given the power entrusted to their position.

Advocates for Defunding Law Enforcement argue that law enforcement agencies across the United States are overfunded. They push for funds to be diverted to other efforts that will benefit people and aid those in need before they resort to crime.

Supporters of Transgender Rights push for laws and policies that will extend legal protections to Sex and Gender Identity so that minority identities relating to sex and gender can't be discriminated against.
Advocates for Gender Affirming Care argue that transgender individuals have a right to access the services that aid in transition and should be protected by law.
Supporters of Transgender Athletes argue that athletes should be allowed to compete in sports that align with that of their trans identity.

Those in favor of Nationalism advocate for the interests, unity, and sovereignty of one's nation above those of others. It often emphasizes a strong sense of national identity, pride, and solidarity among its citizens.
Proponents of Religious Freedom argue that it is essential to ensure religious beliefs are respected, and the rights to hold and practice those beliefs are protected.
Supporters of Traditional Values argue that there is merit in retaining certain ethical beliefs and that policies that go against those beliefs are detrimental to United States citizens.

Supporters of Religion in Politics argue that religion and spirituality should be allowed to take a more significant role in politics. Those in support state that religion and spirituality are staples of people's beliefs and morals and thus should guide policy.

Supporters of Socialism push for policies and laws that fit with an ideology that works with and empowers communities to have more control over the distribution of resources rather than relying on the exchange of capital.
Supporters of Communism push for policies and laws that ensure resources are distributed based on individual needs.

Cancel Culture is more characterized by its opposition. Those opposing Cancel Culture put forward that people are far too sensitive, and the reactions that call for boycotts and deplatforming are undeserved.

Those who champion Indigenous Rights and Protections argue that the United States government has a responsibility to ensure that Indigenous groups' land, history, and rights have protections and supports enshrined in federal and state laws.
Advocates for Voter ID laws argue that the integrity of elections needs to increase security by requiring stricter proof of eligibility to vote.
Election Fraud Claims is characterized by supporters who argue that forces are interfering with United States elections and that the results may be fraudulent.

Trump's Eligibility as a presidential candidate has become the subject of question due to his role on Jan. 6 and other legal issues. Supporters of Trump's Eligibility argue he should still be allowed to run and that there is not substantial enough reason to block his bid for president.

Those who support Infrastructure Funding argue that current Infrastructure designs and efforts must be maintained and funded. They claim there is no need for a substantial shift in how American Infrastructure is planned and carried out.

Supporters of Infrastructure Reform push for programs that don't just expand but change American infrastructure. They argue the current methods and patterns are not sustainable and that extreme changes are needed.

Advocates for Stricter Gun Control argue that the United States suffers from a unique epidemic of gun violence that affects thousands a year. They push for ways to restrict access to firearms, and some aim to reduce the amount of guns in the public.
Those who support Second Amendment Protections argue that the right to access and own firearms is enshrined in constitutional rights and often push for less restriction on ownership and access.

Those who support Public School Funding argue that public education is underfunded, resulting in a strained and failing system. So, in support, it is argued that more funds should be used to support the public education system.
Those in favor of School Choice argue that parents should have more choices of where to send their kids to school.
Advocates for Classroom Transparency argue that parents need to be allowed more of a role in shaping their children's education. They often point to subjects parents protest being taught.
Supporters of Gender and Sex Education push for more expansive education programs about sex and gender among older students.

Those who advocate for College Expenses/Student Debt argue that the outstanding student debt and the expenses of higher education have ballooned to burden the current generation, holding them back from meaningfully achieving the American Dream.
Advocates for Stricter Drug Policing argue that the best way to combat illicit drugs and abuse is to institute harsher punishments and expand policing authority to capture dealers and users.
Those who support Combating Drug Trafficking push to have more funds and resources used to fight the drug problem at the source and reduce the amount of drugs entering the United States.

Supporters of Abuse Services state the best way to reduce illicit drug use and related crimes is to provide easier access to comprehensive services that help those suffering from or at risk of abusing substances.

The conversation around AI and generative AI constantly shifts as technology develops quickly. Supporters of AI Regulation want to subject AI to rules and expectations to protect users and ensure ethical development and use.

Those in favor of Restoring Net Neutrality argue network neutrality must be protected by law, forbidding internet providers from favoring or slowing internet speeds for specific sites and requiring them to treat all networks equally.

Social Network Censorship is characterized by opposition. Those who oppose Social Network Censorship argue that the platforms do not have a right to interfere with the First Amendment and should not be allowed to shape the conversation online.
Supporters of Automation argue that acceptance and integration of automation will increase productivity, benefit the economy, and can produce higher quality paying jobs in the long run.

Advocates for Rural Connectivity posit that as technology progresses, it becomes essential to ensure those in isolated and rural communities have access to the same technological resources as those in more densely populated areas.
Those who support Addressing Homelessness argue that the United States has a responsibility to assist and protect people experiencing homelessness.
Those who support Decentralize Authority argue that hierarchal, centralized structure of the government should be reduced and government be more as a tool for carrying out group organization.
